instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I have an A1706 820-00239-A that has no power. The ampmeter doesn't even power on, so the mac doesn't pull any voltage

 PPDCIN_G3H it's not shorted - 1k ohm 
PPBUS_G3H is 13 k ohm
PPBUS_HS_CPU = 8 M ohm
PP3V0_G3H = 18 k ohm
PP1V8_SUS = 1.2 k ohm
PP1V2_S3 = 150 ohm

It had the DB500 broken, and I have already replaced (with the same result).
I can't see any oxidation, and don't have any history of it.
Can you help?

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground for all CC1/2 pins of USB-C ports.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
Sorry, but i can't figure it out where I can measure CC1/2 pins.
Are they USBC_XA/B_CC1 and USBC_XA/B_CC2 and can they be measured on the capacitators?
Can you please specify them?

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
HI,

J3300
PIN 3 (XB_CC1) = 0.590V
PIN 53 (XA_CC2) = 0.203V
PIN 6 (XB_CC2) = 0.510V
PIN 52 (XA_CC1) = 0.580V

JB500
PIN 52 (TA_CC1) = 0.616V
PIN 6 (TB_CC2) = 0.625V
PIN 3 (TB_CC1) = 0.622V
PIN 53 (TA_CC2) = 0.617V

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
"PIN 53 (XA_CC2) = 0.203V"
This looks bad.
Check the components connected there.
Possibly bad C3215 chip.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
The cd3215C had a small burnt hole... I replaced and the short is gone, but still no power, and ampmeter powerd off.
PIN 53 (XA_CC2) = 0.600V and 12M ohm
Also the D3328 was broken and i replaced it. However i have 0V on diode mode and 100 M ohm of resistance in the pin 31 of the J3300

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Still black meter, not 5V?
Check XB_CC2 too; had low value before.
In fact this CD3215 pair has all values lower than other pair.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
The amp meter is fully black. (now it tries to start, but immediately goes fully black. Very,very quickly almost not noted)). Previously, it was always full black).
PIN 3 (XB_CC1) = 0.600V
PIN 53 (XA_CC2) = 0.617V
PIN 6 (XB_CC2) = 0.510V
PIN 52 (XA_CC1) = 0.580V

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
XB_CC2 is still too low, comparing with the other lines.
Check diode protection, or corresponding CD3215 chip.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Sorry, but I didn't understood what you meant by " Check diode protection, or corresponding CD3215 chip ". C3214 and DZ3351 seems to be ok. Shell I replace this CD3215?
PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS seems to be shorted. On it i get 0.13 ohm of resistance and 0.0002mV on diode mode, and the D3370 seems to be a little decolourized (not sure).

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Remove R3370 and check if short gone.
First remove USB-C connectors from shell and clean the pins.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
I can't find the  R3370  on my schematics. Are you sure this is the one?
Already clean the pins, and i'm testing without the  connectors  but same result

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message: Sorry, D3370...

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message: I lifted up D3370 and the pad was gone (burnt). The short disapered and so i made a jumper from C3354 pad, and solder the diode back again. The short is gone, but still no power (black meter)

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Do you get any voltage at F3000/1?
If not, then change U3200.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I don't get any voltages on F3000/1, but something funny happens:
On one of the ports of J3300, if I flip the meter, the meter works and the mac puls 4.97V, and consumes 0.13A In this case, i get 5V on F3001, and 0V on F3000

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message: This happens because one port still have one good CC1/2 line.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message: Shall I remove U3200?

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
You must replace it.
The board will not work if one CD3215 chip is missing.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message: After replace U3200, now, on one port JB500, the meter shows 4.97B and 0.07A and stays powered on steady, and on all other ports, the meter starts for about 3 sec, shows 4.97V and them reboots

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
The steady port still has problem.
Check diode mode on LDO rails of all CD3215 chips.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
I think that are  all normal...

U3100:
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO = 0.515V
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA = 0.534V
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD = 0.493V
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC =0.529V

U3200:
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO = 0.518V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA = 0.527V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD = 0.487V
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC =0.522V

UB300:
PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO = 0.505V
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOA = 0.533V
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD = 0.489V
PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC =0.526V

UB400:
PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO = 0.515V
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOA = 0.532V
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOD = 0.493V
PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC =0.529V

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
JB500 has 2 USB-C ports.
Each port has 2 ways conection possible; 4 possibilities then.
Check which CD3215 gives the steadt¡y 5V.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
I belive that it is the UB300, because with that i have 5V on FB200. 

I think that this one is the problem, because i have 0.150V in diode mode, and only 0.600 k ohm on FB200, while on F3000 i get 2.6 K ohm and 0.191V on diode mode (not sure if it makes sense to you).

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message: Do you get 1V1 LDO on all chips?

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
What do you mean? In diode mode all look the same.
Do you mean 1.1V on all ports, with the meter conected?

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
The powered CD3215 chip should give 1V1 LDO.
Check if all chips do the same.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message: I don't have 1.1V even on CB404, witch is the corresponding UB400 that works with the meter (5V). I get 0V there. Am I measuring right?

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
On UB300 i get the 1.1V
On UB400 i get 1.1V until reboots
On U3200 and U3100 I don't get the 1.1V. I get 0V on both 1.1V LDO lines, but i get 5V on F3000/1

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Be sure to connect charger to corresponding USB-C port.
1V1 LDO appears at only one chip.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
I get 1V1 LCO on UB300 (steady), and on UB400 (until reboots meter).
I don't get it on U3100 and U3200, witch were the ones  I replaced

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Did you change both U3100/200?
Be sure to get good chips; new from China can be fake.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Yes i changed U3100 and U32000, both new from China.
Is there any way for me to confirm if the chips are ok? When i changed both, the meter went from black to reboot, and now i get 5V on both fuses, and a steady 4.97V on one of the ports (with original CD3215 UB300).

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Too many "new" fake chips from China.
I prefer wing boards they sell after cut off the main logic boards.
You can expect 10-30% of burnt chips.
At least the you can get original chips.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
I have a scrap board here from a 1706 and tomorow i'll reball those CD3215.
Can you send me some link from where you buy those wings?
Tks.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
I replaced again both CD3215 (U3100 / U3200) for two from a scrap board, but with the same result. The meter is rebooting on 3 ports, and stays steady, at 4.97V, on one of the ports (UB300). All LDO lines are as they were before.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message: Then UB300 is possibly defective.

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
Hi, I've replaced the UB300, and now the U3100 is steady, and all other ports are rebooting the meter...
Do you have any other ideas, or is better to give up on it?

threads.title: A1706 820-00239-A no power
threads.message:
If now power cycles, possibly problem on secondary power supplies.
Check them for short.

Also see what happens in SMC bypass mode.
